subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: The United States Walker Cup captain Buddy Marucci won the U.S.G.A. Senior Amateur, beating George Zahringer, 2-up, at Shady Oaks Country Club in Fort Worth. Marucci, 56, of Villanova, Pa., won for the first time in 51 starts in United States Golf Association events. Marucci, best known for losing to Tiger Woods in the 1995 United States Amateur final, received an invitation to play in the 2009 and 2010 United States Senior Opens and an exemption from local qualifying to next year’s United States Open. ¶Diane Lang won the U.S.G.A. Senior Women’s Amateur for the third time in four years, beating Toni Wiesner, 6 and 5, at Tulsa Country Club. Lang, 53, a Jamaican who lives in Weston, Fla., also won the 2005 and 2006 tournaments. The sixth player to win the event three or more times, she also was a semifinalist in 2007, making her 22-1 in four years in the event. lang (AP).
